One of the most basic tasks when analyzing data is to look at the relationship between 2 binary variables. Eg., is there a connection between whether or not someone smokes, and whether or not they have a disease? What about sunny weather and getting to work on time? Playing video games and lines of code I write?

When building statistical models, in addition to knowing whether or not there is a relationship, we also need to estimate the size of the relationship. Sure, smoking makes it more likely to get disease X – but how much more likely? A lot of the problems in Big Data nowadays involve building models over data sets involving millions of variables, with only a small amount of data per variable. If
